subject: New tuning idea?
author: johniestring
full_text:
Just wondering if anybody has ever thought about making a wind tuned ghost box. 
	My idea is to put a Theremin like charged antenna in a cardboard cylinder about 1 to 2 foot tall with a diameter of about 5 to 10 inches with a wind inlet at the bottom and a screen at the top. The wind would blow a light piece of material around in the cylinder that would change the capacitance seen by the antenna. I was thinking you could probably hook the thing to an old non-electronically tuned radio directly across the tuning capacitor or in place of it. At least thats what I would try first. It will probably need some sort of amplification and or filtering or something, don't know, just a hack electrician here. 
	It would be nice if the light piece of material was a ball of hair from a loved one but I would guess that a piece or more of aluminized mylar would probably work better. And the  antenna should be offset to the side so the hairball could go up and down out of the field to choose whatever station the "others" would like.
